article_1.author: Vollan Okoth Ochieng
article_1.summary: Open education resource platforms improve access to education and are globalising education on a scale never seen before.
article_1.title: Open education resources offer many benefits: how to remove obstacles

article_2.author: Rongedzayi Fambasayi
article_2.summary: Policy changes and advocacy efforts have lead to improvements in the protection and wellbeing of children on the continent. But a lot more still needs to be done.
article_2.title: Africa’s agenda for children: progress, but still a long way to go

article_3.author: Rory McGreal
article_3.summary: Open-educational resources are critical for increasing global learners’ access to education during COVID-19 and beyond. Blockchain technology can address concerns about plagiarism in resources.
article_3.title: How blockchain could help the world meet the UN’s global goals in higher education

article_4.author: Zahraa McDonald
article_4.summary: The inequalities in South Africa’s education are systematically being exposed at a scale not experienced before.
article_4.title: COVID-19 exposes the underbelly of South Africa’s education system
